title: 110_hr3635
content: The Act titled "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2007" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center under the Public Health Service Act. The "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2007" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center (referred to as the 'Center') through the Public Health Service Act. The Center's duties include advancing State organ and tissue donor registries, facilitating information exchange between registries, ensuring compliance with funding requirements, and providing technical assistance to States. The "Everson Walls and Ron Springs Gift for Life Act of 2007" establishes a National Organ and Tissue Donor Registry Resource Center to advance State registries, maintain a registry information clearinghouse, and authorize appropriations of $5,000,000 for fiscal years 2008 through 2012. "Section 3 introduces grants for state organ and tissue donor registries under the Public Health Service Act." The Secretary awards grants to eligible entities for State organ and tissue donor registries. Eligible entities are State agencies or contracted entities. Funds must be used to develop, expand, or maintain registries and establish improvement benchmarks. Operating standards must be maintained for receiving grants. The tissue donor registry must allow donors to include statements about anatomical gifts, be accessible to organ procurement organizations 24/7, and ensure personally identifiable information is protected. The tissue donor registry must protect personally identifiable information with donor consent for anatomical gift purposes. Entities seeking grants must submit applications to the Secretary as required. Reporting is mandatory every 180 days for grant recipients. An eligible entity must submit a report to the Secretary detailing the use of grant funds and assessing initiatives for replication in other states. $10,000,000 is authorized for each fiscal year from 2008 to 2012 for this purpose. SEC. 4. STUDY ON FEASIBILITY OF ESTABLISHING A LIVING DONOR DATABASE. An amendment to the Public Health Service Act calls for a study to determine the feasibility of creating a living donor database to track the health effects of living organ donors.
